result.execSummary:
The defendant Vashawn K Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No illegal substances.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the N.S. rising to the level if probable cause for arrest.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
Complete the parenting course.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 9-5-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vashawn K Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court with attorney Matt E Last.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/05/14.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete the parenting course.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No illegal substances.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the N.S. rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
Counsels in  court.  Due to a scheduling error, the 6/12/14 sentencing is rescheduled to 6/19/14 at 8:30 am.  rmm

Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court with attorney Matt Last.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 40.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court with attorney Matt Last.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court with attorney Matt Last.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Vashawn K Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Vashawn K Smith in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
